Package bio.singa.mathematics.geometry.edges

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • bio.singa.mathematics.geometry.edges.Line
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleLineSegment
    public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
    A line is a straight one-dimensional figure having no thickness and extending infinitely in both directions. It is uniquely defined by two distinct points or a single point and its slope.
    See Also:
    Wikipedia: Line (geometry)

    • Method Detail

      • calculateSlope

        public static double calculateSlope​(Vector2D first,
                                    Vector2D second)
        Gets the slope or gradient of the line, calculated by 
         m = (y2 - y1)/(x2 - x1).
        Parameters:
        first - The first point of the line.
        second - The second point of the line.
        Returns:
        The slope.

      • calculateYIntercept

        public static double calculateYIntercept​(Vector2D first,
                                         double slope)
        Gets the y-intercept of the line, calculated by 
         b = (y1 - x1) * slope
        Parameters:
        first - The first point of the line.
        slope - The slope of the line.
        Returns:
        The y-intercept of the equation of the line segment.

        public double getSlope()

      • getXIntercept

        public double getXIntercept()
        Gets the x-intercept of the line.
        If the line is horizontal the result will be Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.
        Returns:
        The x-intercept of the equation of the line segment.

      • getParallel

        public Line getParallel​(double distance)
        Returns a new line parallel to this line, separated by the given (Euclidean-)distance. Negative distances return lines below, respectively left of this line and positive distances vice versa.
        Parameters:
        distance - The offset distance of the new parallel line.
        Returns:
        A new line parallel to this one.

      • getIntersectWithLine

        public Vector2D getIntersectWithLine​(Line line)
        Returns a point where the two lines intersect, if they are not parallel.
        Parameters:
        line - Another line.
        Returns:
        The intersection.

      • mirrorVector

        public Vector2D mirrorVector​(Vector2D originalVector)
        Returns the mirror image of the given point, using this line as the mirror axis.
        Parameters:
        originalVector - The original point.
        Returns:
        The mirrored point.

      • isHorizontal

        public boolean isHorizontal()
        Returns true, if this line is horizontal (i.e. it's slope is zero).
        Returns:
        true, if this line is horizontal

      • isVertical

        public boolean isVertical()
        Returns true, if this line is vertical (i.e. it's slope is infinite).
        Returns:
        true, if this line is vertical
